author: India Today News Desk
title: IMD Weather updates: 'Cold day' warning for Delhi-NCR for 2 days, dense fog to engulf north India - India Today
text: Dense fog is expected to engulf most parts of Northern India including Punjab, Haryana, south-east Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, western Bihar and north-west Rajasthan for the next two days, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Friday.The weather body also issued a "cold-day" alert for the Delhi-NCR region.In its advisory, the weather department added that the foggy conditions may affect flight operations, vehicular movement and train operations in the region.Earlier on Friday evening, moderate fog was observed in parts of Uttar Pradesh and isolated pockets of north-west Rajasthan, Punjab, south-east Uttarakhand, Assam, Haryana and Delhi. Fog layer (encircled grey patch) over Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, west Bihar and northwest Rajasthan. (Photo:X) COLD DAY IN DELHIThe IMD also issued a "cold-day" alert and said "dense to very dense fog" is likely to be witnessed in Delhi-NCR for the next two days.Notably, a cold day takes place when, on two consecutive days, the minimum temperature of a place is lower than 10 degrees Celsius and the maximum temperature (or day temperature) drops by 4.5 to 6.4 degrees below normal.The maximum temperature of the national capital settled at 19.8 degrees Celsius on Friday, a notch below the season's average. The 24-hour average Air Quality Index (AQI) was recorded at 382, in the "very poor" category, at 4 pm as per the IMD.An AQI between zero and 50 is considered "good", 51 and 100 "satisfactory", 101 and 200 "moderate", 201 and 300 "poor", 301 and 400 "very poor", and 401 and 500 "severe".Published By: Sudeep LavaniaPublished On: Dec 29, 2023ALSO READ | Several trains, flights delayed as dense fog engulfs North India; no relief till Jan 2

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Long Beach State Women's Volleyball Welcomes Naseri Tumanuvao
text:
Long Beach State Women’s Volleyball Welcomes Naseri Tumanuvao
Long Beach State Women's Volleyball has appointed Naseri Tumanuvao as the new Associate Head Coach. Tumanuvao, a seasoned collegiate coach with a decade of experience in the Big West, previously served at UC Irvine, where he significantly improved the team's performance. Head Coach Natalie Reagan praised Tumanuvao's experience and recruitment abilities, emphasizing his commitment to developing student-athletes both on and off the court. His local ties and involvement in the volleyball community position him well to strengthen the program.
By the Numbers- Tumanuvao helped UC Irvine improve from last in 2019 to four consecutive seasons of .500 or better in Big West play.
- As a player, Tumanuvao graduated with 636 career kills and was named NAIA Player of the Year.
- Tumanuvao joins a Long Beach State program looking to enhance its competitiveness in the Big West.
- The coaching staff aims to leverage Tumanuvao’s local connections and recruitment skills to attract talent.
With Tumanuvao on board, the focus will shift to solidifying team culture and strategizing recruitment plans ahead of the upcoming season. His integration into the program will likely look to strengthen Long Beach’s performance in future competitions.
Bottom LineNaseri Tumanuvao's hiring marks a crucial step for Long Beach State Women's Volleyball, bringing experienced leadership and community ties that are expected to promote player development and enhance the program's reputation in collegiate volleyball.
Read more at Long Beach State University Athletics

author: Dan Marsh
title: Declan Rice falls at first hurdle after Mikel Arteta's prediction for Arsenal vs West Ham - Mirror Online
text:
Declan Rice endured a night to forget as Arsenal fell to defeat against West Ham in his first league meeting between his new club and his former employers.
Rice, 24, decided to leave his former club at the end of the 2022/23 campaign in order to compete for major honours and became Arsenal's marquee signing in a club-record deal worth £105million back in the summer transfer window.
And while the Gunners are in the thick of the Premier League title race and safely through to the knockout stages of the Champions League , Rice was on the losing side on Thursday night as West Ham beat Mikel Arteta's side 2-0 at the Emirates .
Although Rice has enjoyed a fine start to his Arsenal career, he was challenged to increase his output in front of goal by Arteta prior to the match. The Spaniard told Amazon Prime Sport: "That [goals] is something he can add. The areas and the spaces he occupies on the field is going to determine if he is elite and if he can do it more often. He’s playing in a more defensive role so it is more difficult to do that."
Unfortunately for Arteta, Rice never looked like answering that call to arms against his old club. On the occasions in the second-half that he did foray forward, two shots from range failed to trouble Alphonse Areola, who enjoyed a relatively carefree night in the visiting goal. And just to compound Rice's misery, he gave away a penalty in added time which would have made things even worse were it not for a fine save from David Raya.
The result means Arsenal head into the final round of fixtures in 2023 two points behind Liverpool at the Premier League summit. They face Fulham next at Craven Cottage on Sunday.
Join the debate! What did you make of Rice's performance v West Ham? Let us know here.
Speaking prior to the match, Amazon Prime pundit Alan Shearer insisted that Rice has already proven he can be so much more than a defensive midfielder. He said of Arsenal's £105m man: "His runs tells you he can be so much more than a six or a defensive midfielder.
"In terms of a midfielder and what you want from him in terms of tackling, protecting and goals, he can give you everything. For me, what they spent on him was an absolute bargain."
Former Premier League marksman Jermain Defoe echoed similar sentiments, adding: " When we’re talking about the elite, people mention him along the likes of Steven Gerrard and with Stevie, he has played as a six, played as a 10 and can play all of these different positions.
"I think he can do that as well and he is the complete midfielder, I think he can play higher up and I believe if he does play higher up, he will score more goals like we saw last season for West Ham."
